nextLink.description: Information to be provided to the API call in order to retrieve next set of data as part of pagination. It could be a simple number or full URL representing MS Graph API navigation. This information should not be generated by hand or changed. In case of MS Graph API, please only use tokens the server gives you and do not bring them from outside.

Number.summary: Number for the next page in the navigation flow

Uri.summary: Complete URL with details of the request and a skip token for MS Graph to parse and respond.

offeringId.description: Unique identifier of the marketplace offering
offeringId.name: offeringId

schema.description: Unique identifier of the marketplace offering.

valid offering ID.description: An example of an valid marketplace offering ID in type UUID.

valid search term.description: An example valid search term used in object filtering in a query.

securityClass.description: The security class of managed object to retrieve. Unknown values, will be ignored. Please see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/security/compass/privileged-access-security-levels for a description of security levels.

Privileged.description: An example enum string that indicates the security class of an managed object is privileged.

templateId.description: Reference to the specific configuration item that is deployed in the tenant.

valid template ID.summary: Example of a valid template ID

202.description: The process to create a report has started.

401.description: Principal is not authorized to access this endpoint. Check to make sure the Bearer token is valid and present!

403.description: Principal does not contain the correct scopes (permissions) for the API call that was made, or was made from the wrong tenant. If the permissions were granted, ensure that the access token was requested with the correct scopes.

404.description: The requested object was not found.

409.description: A job is already in progress.

525.description: Infrastructure not deployed. Please deploy the infrastructure before using this endpoint.

Core.SystemRequirements.title: Core - System Requirements
Core.SystemRequirements.description: Collection of indicators that notify the caller if the system requirements have been met for various sub components to operate.

authenticatorPermissions.description: Flag that indicates if the core permissions for the SHIELD - Authenticator App have been configured properly or not.

azurePermissions.description: Flag that indicates if the required core Azure RBAC assignment(s) are present or not.

defendEntitlement.description: Flag that indicates if the required defend licenses are present or not.

deployEntitlement.description: Flag that indicates if the required deploy licenses are present or not.

discoverEntitlement.description: Flag that indicates if the required discover licenses are present or not.

msGraphPermissions.description: Flag that indicates if the core permissions for the Microsoft Graph API have been configured properly or not.

dataGatewayPermissions.description: Flag that indicates if the core permissions for the SHI - Data Gateway have been configured properly or not.

entraDirectoryRole.description: Flag that indicates if the core permissions for Entra Directory Role assignment have been configured properly or not.

currentStep.description: Current step/value for the progress bar. This is in relation to the `totalStepCount` property. If undefined, an indeterminate/pulsing progress bar is used instead.

totalStepCount.description: Number of steps before the progress bar is completely filed.

Discover.ExecutionStatus.title: Discover - Status
Discover.ExecutionStatus.description: Detailed status that indicates the current state of the Discover engine and its progress.

running.description: Flag that indicates if another run is already in progress or not.

ManagedObject.Intermediary.description: Base template for all intermediary objects to inherit from.

kind.description: Type of Intermediary that the properties are describing.

name.description: Human friendly name of the AVD cluster. This will be displayed to end users in the remote desktop app and web portals.

ManagedObject.Intermediary.title: Intermediary - Base Type

addressRangeCIDR.description: Optional Virtual Network IP Address range, defaults to 10.0.0.0/16.

assignmentGroup.description: Read-only value that the server generates that is the Object ID of the user assignment security group for the current instance of the AVD intermediary.

index.description: Used to uniquely name multiple session hosts in a single host pool.

location.description: Azure Regions that are available for the configured subscription. Resources will be deployed to the region specified here.

resourceId.description: ID of the Host Pool. This is generated by the server and can't be set, hence the read only flag.

sessionHostGroup.description: Read-only value that the server generates that is the Object ID of the session host security group for the current instance of the AVD intermediary.

sessionHostPrefix.description: Short name to append to the beginning of the session host VMs. The max computer name length is 15, 4 chars are reserved for indexing and 4 for prefixing.

vmSku.description: SKU ID in Azure of the VM session host set that is to be deployed.

LicenseReport.CorrelationRecord.description: Metadata that describes the execution session (run) that is used to tie/relate all of the license report together.

auditTenantAccount.description: The user account used to retrieve the license information in the tenant being audited.

correlationId.description: The ID of the execution session (run) that is used to tie/relate all of the data together.

reportTenantAccount.description: User account used to store/report the license report to the SHI Lab cloud service.

tenantId.description: Unique ID of customer's Microsoft tenant that the license report is for.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the report was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp of when the report was last updated.

LicenseReport.CorrelationRecord.title: License Report - Correlation Record

assignedLicense.description: License assignment on the specified principal.

assignedService.description: Service configuration assignment.  This is used to record the set of principals that are "benefiting" from the service, regardless of license status.

consumedService.description: Usage telemetry retrieved for the service to indicate if the specific principal is consuming the service or not, regardless of license status.

LicenseReport.LicenseData.description: Collection of principals that have had their in-use licenses and assigned licenses. Where the key is the principal ID and the value is the insights.
LicenseReport.LicenseData.title: License Report - License Data

LicenseReport.FeatureBreakdown.description:
List of features that are configured for the specific service plan's service configuration for the related principal.
The key is the name of the feature that is being described.
The value is the state of the feature configuration, `true` is in scope and `false` meaning not in scope.
LicenseReport.FeatureBreakdown.title: License Report - Feature Breakdown

LicenseReport.description: Completely calculated license report structure that is the result of a complete run.

availableLicense.description: Breakdown of the purchased licenses/service plans available in the tenant being audited for this run. Where the key is the ID of the service plan and the value is how many licenses are available/purchase for it.
availableLicense.title: License Report - Available Licenses

LicenseReport.title: License Report - Complete Object

ManagedObject.Device.title: Managed Device
ManagedObject.Device.description: Structure that represents a all of the states a managed device could be in.

commissionedDate.description: This is the ISO 8601 string format of the time representing the commission date of the PAW.

displayName.description: Current computer name of the device according to Entra ID. Empty string indicates that the device has not joined Entra ID yet.

id.description: Entra ID Device ID (Not Object ID) of the specified device.

parentDeviceId.description: DeviceID of the parent PAW device.

uniqueGroupId.description: The object ID of the unique security group that contains the managed Entra ID Device Identity.

ManagedObject.PrivilegedDevice.description: Set of properties that are available on privileged managed device objects only.
ManagedObject.PrivilegedDevice.title: Managed Device - Privileged

groupAssignmentId.description: This is the ID of the Custom CSP Device Configuration that configures the local admin and local hyper-v group memberships.

userAssignmentId.description: The ID of the Settings Catalog that contains the user rights assignment of the specified PAW device.

userAssignmentList.description: List of Object IDs for the privileged user accounts that are assigned to this device.

ManagedObject.User.title: Managed User
ManagedObject.User.description: A user object that has limited properties. The user object is generated by combining multiple pieces of metadata from Entra ID and SHIELD.

creationDate.description: A date object representing when the user managed by SHIELD.

displayName.description: The name shown on UIs for the privileged user according to Entra ID.

firstName.description: Given name of the privileged user according to Entra ID.

id.description: The Entra ID Object ID of the managed user. This is the one property that is stored in the settings engine. This is the key in the storage systems to uniquely separate the managed user's data from others.

intermediaryAssignmentList.description: List of intermediaries that the user is assigned to.

lastName.description: Surname/family name of the privileged user according to Entra ID.

upn.description: User principal name of the user object according to Azure Active Directory.

siloAssignmentList.description: List of silos that the user is assigned to.

uiEducation.description: Indicates if user education is enabled in the UI for the specified user. True is on, false is off.

uniqueGroupId.description: ObjectID of the unique user group that the managed user is a member of.

ManagedObject.PrivilegedUser.title: Managed User - Privileged
ManagedObject.PrivilegedUser.description: Additional settings that represents a privileged user object. All data in this structure is preserved in the settings engine's permanent storage system.

deviceAssignmentList.description: List of devices that the privileged users are able to use as endpoints.

generatedPassword.description: The password that was created for the managed user upon managed user creation, this is not stored. This is only available once during user creation. If the password is lost, reset the PWD in Entra ID or have the user perform SSPR.

parentId.description: The Entra ID Object ID of the object that the manged user is tied to. This value is only present on privileged users.

temporaryAccessPass.description: A TAP that was created for the managed user upon managed user creation, this is not stored. This is only available once during user creation. TAP expires at the configured tenant expiration time.

SecurityClassList.description: Security class types as described in https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/security/compass/privileged-access-security-levels.
SecurityClassList.title: Type of security class the object(s) belongs to

EntraID.description: The Access Token from Entra ID for the `SHIELD - End User Login` Enterprise App (may need to be created from the App Registration).

info.description: Deprive your threats of practical significance. Deploy the Securing Privilege Access architecture. All in a few seconds.
info.title: SHI Environment Lockdown and Defense

get.description: Provides a detailed breakdown of if the system requirements are being met for the various components of the SHIELD.

System Requirement.summary: Example system requirement object returned form the API endpoint
System Requirement.description:
An example that indicates:
- Azure RBAC assignment(s) are not present.
- SHIELD Defend licenses are present.
- SHIELD Deploy licenses are present.
- SHIELD Discover licenses are present.
- Permissions for the Microsoft Graph API have not been configured properly.
- Permissions for the SHI - Data Gateway have not been configured properly.
- Permissions for Entra Directory Role assignment have not been configured properly.

get.summary: Indicates if the System Requirements are met or not.

get.description: Provides the Tenant ID and the Application ID of the service principal that access tokens need to be issued against. This is also useful for configuring public clients to be able to authenticate to for auth code flows.

appId.description: Application ID that should be used in Access Tokens as the audience and the endpoint necessary for auth code flows.

tenantId.description: Tenant ID necessary for authority host URL configuration and UI customization.

valid request.description: An example request object to retrieve the IDs required to authenticate.

get.summary: Retrieves the IDs required to authenticate.
Provides Attestation for Authenticator App
get.description:
Provides the attestation to the authenticator that this endpoint is authorized for receiving credentials from the authenticator.

This endpoint requires the `Authentication.Actions.Attest`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission).

schema.description: Access token that SHIELD uses to prove it is a valid recipient of credentials.

valid access token.description: An example string that represents the access token that SHIELD uses to prove it is a valid recipient of credentials.

get.summary: Indicates if SHIELD is waiting for any credentials.
get.description:
Provides a breakdown view of if SHIELD is waiting for any specific type of credential or credentials.

This endpoint requires the `Authentication.Read`, `Authentication.ReadWrite`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission).

Waiting on Nothing.description: No credentials are being requested at the moment.

Waiting on Access Token.description: Waiting on an Access Token with the Audience of the Legacy Windows Graph API.

Waiting on SccAuth.summary: Waiting on an SCC Auth data
Waiting on SccAuth.description: Waiting on an SCC Auth data from the SHIELD - Authenticator App.

post.description:
Configure SHIELD to use the specific SCC Auth credentials from the authenticator app to run web requests on behalf of the end user.

This endpoint requires the `Authentication.ReadWrite`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission).

valid Scc Auth credentials.description: An example of valid Scc Auth credentials used to configure SHIELD.

post.summary: Provide Your SHIELD Authenticator Credentials - SCC Auth
Provide Your SHIELD Authenticator Credentials - Access Token
post.description:
Configure SHIELD to use the specific Access Token credentials from the authenticator app to run web requests on behalf of the end user.

This endpoint requires the `Authentication.ReadWrite`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission).

schema.description: Access Token to be stored in the SHIELD authentication engine.

token.description: This is transmitted as a property instead of a raw string as the body parser ignores it in Express.JS. Functionally identical though.

Valid request body.description: An example object that represents the request body to be sent to the API endpoint.

get.summary: Checks if an Update Is Pending
get.description: Provides the state of the update engine. Where `true` means there is an update detected and `false` means there isn't an update available. This endpoint is available to all authorization levels.

Example value.description: An example boolean value that represents an update to SHIELD is pending.

get.summary: Checks for a New Version
get.description:
Checks with data gateway and compares the reported version to the version that is locally installed. If there is a difference, a new update is marked as available. Always returns the latest version available on data gateway, even if that version is installed locally.

This endpoint requires the `Update.Read`, `Update.ReadWrite`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission).

appVersion.description: Follows symantec versioning as laid out here: https://semver.org/. This number is the version of the application package.

Example response.description: An example of latest semantic version of the SHIELD available.

get.summary: Checks for a New Version in Channel
get.description:
Checks with the SHI Data Gateway in the specified update channel and compares the reported version to the version that is locally installed. If there is a difference, a new update is marked as available. Always returns the latest version available on data gateway, even if that version is installed locally.

This endpoint requires the `Update.Read`, `Update.ReadWrite`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission).

appVersion.description: Follows symantec versioning as laid out here: https://semver.org/. This number is the version of the application package.

SHIELD version.description: An example string that represents the latest semantic version of SHIELD available in specific channel.

post.description:
Installs the latest version that is available from SHI Data Gateway. Even if that version is the same that is installed.

This endpoint requires the `Update.ReadWrite`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission).

post.summary: Installs SHIELD Core Update from Channel
post.description:
Installs the latest version that is available from SHI Data Gateway in the specified channel. Even if that version is the same that is installed.

This endpoint requires the `Update.ReadWrite`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission).

THIS API SHOULD ONLY BE USED IF INSTRUCTED BY SHI EMPLOYEES!

Uploads the specified ZIP package, validates signature and installs it if it matches. This ignores version numbers and will allow you to install the same version again if necessary.

This endpoint requires the `Update.ReadWrite`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission).

get.summary: Returns State of the Discover Module
get.description:
Provides a detailed breakdown of the current state of the discover module and it progress.

This endpoint requires the `Discover.Read`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission).

Execution Status.description: An example execution status object that indicates a SHIELD Discover run is already in progress.

get.summary: Returns Current Execution Progress of the Discover Module
get.description:
Provides a detailed breakdown of the current progress of the discover module and it progress.

This endpoint requires the `Discover.Read`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission).

value.description: Collecting data from the Microsoft Entra ID system.

Progress Bar.description:
An example progress bar object returned from the endpoint. It indicates:
- The purpose of a progress bar.
- The text label of a progress bar.
- The unique identifier in type UUID of a specific SHIELD instance for search.
- The total number of steps of a progress bar.
- The current step/value of a progress bar.
- No child progress bar.

get.summary: Starts Discover's Report Generation
get.description:
Starts the Discover module's report collection engine to create a license report and upload it to the data gateway.

This endpoint requires the `Discover.Action.Run`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission).

Retrieves the list of correlation records for the authenticated tenant. Correlation records store the metadata for a specific license report.

This endpoint requires the `Discover.Read`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission).

anything.description: Sample list of correlation records for the authenticated tenant.

get.summary: Retrieve the List of Correlation Records

get.description:
Retrieves the full license report for the specified correlation ID in the authenticated tenant. The license report contains all of the license usage and compliance information with the required correlation data.

This endpoint requires the `Discover.Read`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission).

License Report.description: Sample, truncated report from an example customer environment.

get.summary: Retrieve the Specified License Report
Gets the Current Status of the Infrastructure Deployment
get.description:
Has the core infrastructure engine check if the config engine can initialize properly.

This endpoint requires the `Deploy.Read`, `Deploy.ReadWrite`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission).

Infra deployed.description: All API calls should be available since the core infrastructure is deployed.

Infra not deployed.description: Infrastructure is not deployed. Please run the deployment before attempting different API calls.

deployedArchitecture.description: Reference of the architecture type being deployed that defines what resources could be targeted.

deployTagInclude.description: Flag that indicates if the tag list has been set to be in inclusion mode (`true`) or exclusion mode (`false`).

deployedTags.description: Collection of references to the groupings that list related or dependent resources to be deployed.

isDeploying.description: Flag to indicate if process has started and ongoing (true) or not (false).

post.summary: Deploys the Core Infrastructure Architecture Specification
post.description:
After the user consents, deploy the core security groups, scope tag, configurations and metadata.

This endpoint requires the `Deploy.ReadWrite`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission).

Ignorant Deploy Request.description: Clueless dev trying to automate this application without reading the docs. RTFM!

No User Consent.description: User did not agree to the terms and conditions. This post should not have been sent.

User Consented.description: User agreed to the terms and conditions and pressed the deploy button.

deploymentConsent.description: Flag that indicates the end user has consented to deploying the architecture (`true`) or not (`false`).

architectureId.description: Reference of the architecture type being deployed that defines what resources could be targeted.

tagList.description: Collection of references to the groupings that list related or dependent resources to be deployed.

include.description: Flag to indicate if calculated resources should be included (true) or excluded (false) from the deploy.

202.description: Request for deployment is accepted and process is running

400.description: User information or choice are invalid for the operation

503.description: System requirements have not been met!

patch.summary: Augments the list of tags set as deployed and provisions new resources
patch.description:
Changes the list of tags based on include flags, calculates the list of matchings resources and deploys all the ones marked as not provisioned.

This endpoint requires the `Deploy.ReadWrite`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission).

Invalid Request.description: User submits request with empty list.

Acceptable Request.description: User provides one or more values for the list of tags.

202.description: Request for changes is accepted and deployment of the additional resources is running

400.description: User information is invalid/incomplete for the operation

503.description: System requirements have not been met!

get.summary: Returns List of Available Architectures
get.description:
Retrieves the collection of possible architecture configurations to be deployed including all metadata accompanying these records.

This endpoint requires the `Deploy.Read`, `Deploy.ReadWrite`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission).

Sample List of Available Architectures.description: Sample list of architecture records available to be deployed.

value.name: Standard Security Baseline
value.description: Provides a standard security baseline for most organizations with core security groups, scope tags and configurations.

value.name: Enhanced Security Posture
value.description: An enhanced security posture architecture with additional configurations and stricter access controls.

get.summary: Returns List of Available Configuration Items
get.description:
Retrieves the collection of all existing configuration items with curated set of metadata.

This endpoint requires the `Deploy.Read`, `Deploy.ReadWrite`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission).

Sample List of Available Configuration I.description: Sample list of configuration item records available to be deployed.

value.name: Core Security Group
value.description: A core security group that contains essential security roles and permissions.

value.name: Scope Tag - Confidential Data
value.description: A scope tag designed to restrict access to confidential data resources.

get.summary: Returns Current Execution Progress of the Deploy Module
get.description:
Provides a detailed breakdown of the current progress of the deploy module and its sub-components, if any.

This endpoint requires the `Deploy.Read`, `Deploy.ReadWrite`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission).

childBar.description: Collecting data from the Microsoft Purview.

value.description: Collecting data from the Microsoft Entra ID system.

Progress Bar.description:
An example progress bar object returned from the endpoint. It indicates:
- The purpose of a progress bar.
- The text label of a progress bar.
- The unique identifier in type UUID of a specific SHIELD instance for search.
- The total number of steps of a progress bar.
- The current step/value of a progress bar.
- With a child progress bar.

get.summary: Retrieves Cached Evaluation Results
get.description:
Returns results of the last performed comparison of the values in the existing resources and their original requested configurations. Resulting object consists of several categories and includes timestamp when the evaluation was performed.

This endpoint requires the `Deploy.Read`, or `Deploy.ReadWrite`, or `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission).

Response with Cached Data.description: An example of the cached results from the previous comparison operation.

invalid.message: Setting ID 'f6f5d07b-230c-4818-93de-e407b8ca9537' - Insufficient access to view this data.

post.summary: Requests to Run New Evaluation and Returns Results
post.description:
Resets all cached data and initiates process to compar the values in the existing resources and their original requested configurations. Returns resulting object split into several categories and including timestamp when the evaluation was performed.

This endpoint requires the `Deploy.ReadWrite` or `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission).

requestBody.description: No payload is expected or needed for this operation

Response with New Data.description: An example of the newly calculated results after performing comparison operation.

invalid.message: Setting ID 'f6f5d07b-230c-4818-93de-e407b8ca9537' - Insufficient access to view this data.

503.description: Deployed architecture is invalid or missing!

get.summary: Retrieves List of Existing Override Rules
get.description:
Retrieves the details of override property in the Settings Engine and returns list grouped by configuration item reference.

This endpoint requires `Deploy.Read`, or `Deploy.ReadWrite`, or `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission).

Example Response with Current Rules.summary: Example of the returned list of the skipped items
Example Response with Current Rules.description: An example of the list indicating configuration items and the properties that are designed to be ignored during the comparison operation.

items.description: Flat path representing entire item or specific nested property in the configuration item.

schema.description: Collection of references to configuration items (using templateId property as property name) and array of strings as value.

post.summary: Records New Entry to Skip During Evaluation
post.description:
Stores the reference to the entity to be skipped during the evaluation process. Could be entire configuration item or a specific property.

This endpoint requires the `Deploy.ReadWrite` or `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission).

400.description: The body does not match expected format!

delete.summary: Removes Existing Entry From Being Skipped
delete.description:
Deletes the entry so it is no longer ignored during the evaluation process.

This endpoint requires the `Deploy.ReadWrite` or `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission).

400.description: The body does not match expected format!

patch.summary: Restores the Details Of the Deployed Resource
patch.description:
Calculates and applies a change to the deployed resource to restore original value from the entire configuration item or single property.

This endpoint requires the `Deploy.ReadWrite` or `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission).

204.description: Restoration of configuration item or its property is successful

400.description: The body does not match expected format!

get.summary: Indicates if the Remove Function Can Be Ran
get.description:
Provides a flag that indicates if the core infrastructure removal command can be ran or not.

This endpoint requires the `Deploy.Read`, `Deploy.ReadWrite`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission).

Remove Ready.description: Flag that indicates that no dependent components are present and the core infra can be removed.

Remove Not Ready.description: Flag that indicates that dependent components are present and the core infra should not be removed.

503.description: Deployed architecture is invalid or missing!

delete.description:
Deletes all resources in the tenant that were created during the initial deploy or any update operation since.

This endpoint requires the `Deploy.ReadWrite` or `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission).

202.description: Request for removal is accepted and process initiated

503.description: Deployed architecture is invalid or missing!

get.description:
Retrieves a list of all AVD intermediaries for the specified security class filter. Next links may be provided for pagination to allow for good performance on larger environments. If a nextLink is return, not all data was returned on this query and the next link can be sent back to the API to get the next page of data.

This endpoint requires the `Intermediary.Privileged.Read`, `Intermediary.Privileged.ReadWrite`, `Intermediary.Specialized.Read`, `Intermediary.Specialized.ReadWrite`, `Intermediary.Enterprise.ReadWrite`, `Intermediary.Enterprise.Read`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission). The security class parameter in the URL path corresponds to the same permission in the scope. That means if you are granted a privileged role, you can only call the privilege class URL.

Paged AVD intermediaries.description: An example paged AVD intermediary list returned that represents the current page of all AVD intermediary instances form the specified security class.

get.summary: Retrieves all AVD Intermediary Instances

delete.description:
Deletes the specified intermediary (by the parent group's Entra ID Object ID) using the requested security class as a filter.

This endpoint requires the `Intermediary.Privileged.ReadWrite`, `Intermediary.Specialized.ReadWrite`, `Intermediary.Enterprise.ReadWrite`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission). The security class parameter in the URL path corresponds to the same permission in the scope. That means if you are granted a privileged role, you can only call the privilege class URL.
delete.summary: Deletes a Single AVD Intermediary Instance

get.description:
Retrieves the specified intermediary (by the parent group's Entra ID Object ID) using the requested security class as a filter.

This endpoint requires the `Intermediary.Privileged.Read`, `Intermediary.Privileged.ReadWrite`, `Intermediary.Specialized.Read`, `Intermediary.Specialized.ReadWrite`, `Intermediary.Enterprise.ReadWrite`, `Intermediary.Enterprise.Read`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission). The security class parameter in the URL path corresponds to the same permission in the scope. That means if you are granted a privileged role, you can only call the privilege class URL.

Paged AVD intermediary result.summary: Example paged result of a AVD intermediary list
Paged AVD intermediary result.description: An example paged result that represents the current page of retrieved AVD intermediary list from a parent group filtered by specified class.

get.summary: Retrieves a Single AVD Intermediary Instance

delete.description:
Removes the specified user(s) as identified by their Object ID from the AVD cluster and deletes their corresponding session host(s).

This endpoint requires the `Intermediary.Privileged.ReadWrite`, `Intermediary.Specialized.ReadWrite`, `Intermediary.Enterprise.ReadWrite`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission). The security class parameter in the URL path corresponds to the same permission in the scope. That means if you are granted a privileged role, you can only call the privilege class URL.

One user.description: Removes 1 session host, and removed the requested user from the assignments security group.

Two users.description: Removes 3 session hosts, and removed the requested users from the assignments security group.

delete.summary: Removes the assignment of the specified users

get.description:
Gets the list of assigned user from the specified AVD Intermediary.

This endpoint requires the `Intermediary.Privileged.Read`, `Intermediary.Privileged.ReadWrite`, `Intermediary.Specialized.Read`, `Intermediary.Specialized.ReadWrite`, `Intermediary.Enterprise.ReadWrite`, `Intermediary.Enterprise.Read`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission). The security class parameter in the URL path corresponds to the same permission in the scope. That means if you are granted a privileged role, you can only call the privilege class URL.

Managed user page.description: An example of paged user result that represents the current page of assigned user list retrieved from the specified AVD intermediary.

get.summary: List all assigned users (paginated)

post.description:
Assigns the specified user(s) as identified by their Object ID to the AVD cluster and create corresponding session host(s) for them.

This endpoint requires the `Intermediary.Privileged.ReadWrite`, `Intermediary.Specialized.ReadWrite`, `Intermediary.Enterprise.ReadWrite`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission). The security class parameter in the URL path corresponds to the same permission in the scope. That means if you are granted a privileged role, you can only call the privilege class URL.

One user.description: Creates 1 session host, and added the requested user to the assignments security group.

Two users.description: Creates 3 session hosts, and added the requested users to the assignments security group.

Managed user.description: An example of managed user array returned that represents the users has been assigned to the specified AVD cluster and created corresponding session host successfully.

post.summary: Assigns the list of specified users

get.description:
Get the specified managed user(s) from the specified AVD intermediary assignment list.

This endpoint requires the `Intermediary.Privileged.Read`, `Intermediary.Privileged.ReadWrite`, `Intermediary.Specialized.Read`, `Intermediary.Specialized.ReadWrite`, `Intermediary.Enterprise.ReadWrite`, `Intermediary.Enterprise.Read`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission). The security class parameter in the URL path corresponds to the same permission in the scope. That means if you are granted a privileged role, you can only call the privilege class URL.

Assigned users.description: An example paged assigned user list that represents the current page retrieved from specified AVD intermediary assignment list.

get.summary: Get a specific assigned user

delete.description:
Remove the specified user list from the device.

This endpoint requires the `Device.Privileged.ReadWrite`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission).

Multiple Users.description: Remove multiple user assignments from a managed device.

Single User.description: Remove a single user assignment from a managed device.

Removed user list.description: An example array of ManagedObject.User that represents those removed from specific privileged device assignment.

get.description:
Lists all of the users that are currently assigned to the specified device.

This endpoint requires the `Device.Privileged.Read`, `Device.Privileged.ReadWrite`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission).

Example response.description: An example of ObjectPage.ManagedUser returned that represents the list of users assigned to specific privileged device.

get.summary: List User Assignments

post.description:
Adds the specified list of users to the list of users that are allowed to log in on the specific privileged device.

This endpoint requires the `Device.Privileged.ReadWrite`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission).

1:1 map.description: This example is the security best practice of having only one user mapped to a managed device.

Multi-User Managed Device.description: This example is the security best practice of having multiple users mapped to a managed device.

List of Managed Users.summary: Users assigned to the privileged device
List of Managed Users.description: An example of ManagedObject.User array that represents the list of users which successfully assigned to the specified privileged device.

get.description:
Returns a list of all devices managed or unmanaged.

This endpoint requires the `Device.Privileged.Read`, `Device.Privileged.ReadWrite`, `Device.Specialized.Read`, `Device.Specialized.ReadWrite`, `Device.Enterprise.ReadWrite`, `Device.Enterprise.Read`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission). The security class parameter in the URL path corresponds to the same permission in the scope. That means if you are granted a privileged role, you can only call the privilege class URL. When reading the `unmanaged` objects, any security class permission can read them, no need for a specific `unmanaged` class assignment.

Managed device list.description: An example paged result returned that represents a specific page of managed device list.

get.summary: Get All Devices

post.description:
Commissions a new device, into the device hierarchy and appends appropriate metadata and initial policies. Appends required metadata to proper locations.

This endpoint requires the `Device.Privileged.ReadWrite`, `Device.Specialized.ReadWrite`, `Device.Enterprise.ReadWrite`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission). The security class parameter in the URL path corresponds to the same permission in the scope. That means if you are granted a privileged role, you can only call the privilege class URL.

Request body.description: An example request body object that represents a request to commission the device specified in the deviceId field.

deviceId.description: The SHIELD ID (Entra ID Device ID) of the device to target.

Commissioned managed device.description: An example managed device object returned that represents a successfully commissioned device.

delete.description:
Removes the device from the management hierarchy, removes metadata tagging and issues the wipe command to the devices.

This endpoint requires the `Device.Privileged.ReadWrite`, `Device.Specialized.ReadWrite`, `Device.Enterprise.ReadWrite`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission). The security class parameter in the URL path corresponds to the same permission in the scope. That means if you are granted a privileged role, you can only call the privilege class URL.

get.description:
Get the specified managed device by its Entra ID Device ID.

This endpoint requires the `Device.Privileged.Read`, `Device.Privileged.ReadWrite`, `Device.Specialized.Read`, `Device.Specialized.ReadWrite`, `Device.Enterprise.ReadWrite`, `Device.Enterprise.Read`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission). The security class parameter in the URL path corresponds to the same permission in the scope. That means if you are granted a privileged role, you can only call the privilege class URL.

Managed device.description: An example of ManagedObject.Device object returned that represents a managed device queried by a device ID with specified security class.

get.summary: Get Specified Device by ID

get.description:
Returns a list of all devices managed or unmanaged.

This endpoint requires the `User.Privileged.Read`, `User.Privileged.ReadWrite`, `User.Specialized.Read`, `User.Specialized.ReadWrite`, `User.Enterprise.ReadWrite`, `User.Enterprise.Read`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission). The security class parameter in the URL path corresponds to the same permission in the scope. That means if you are granted a privileged role, you can only call the privilege class URL. When reading the `unmanaged` objects, any security class permission can read them, no need for a specific `unmanaged` class assignment.

Managed user.description: An examples of ObjectPage.ManagedUser returned that represents a page of a managed user list.

get.summary: Get All Users

post.description:
For Specialized or Enterprise, adds existing user into management. For Privileged, securely clones the specified user's properties into a new managed user object in the privileged baselines.

This endpoint requires the `User.Privileged.ReadWrite`, `User.Specialized.ReadWrite`, `User.Enterprise.ReadWrite`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission). The security class parameter in the URL path corresponds to the same permission in the scope. That means if you are granted a privileged role, you can only call the privilege class URL.

Request body.description: An example object that represents a request to assign the specified user to target security class.

userId.description: The Entra ID object ID of the user to clone.

Created or cloned user.description: An example managed user object returned that represents the user brought into management successfully.

delete.description:
Deletes the user account and removes the management artifacts.

This endpoint requires the `User.Privileged.ReadWrite`, `User.Specialized.ReadWrite`, `User.Enterprise.ReadWrite`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission). The security class parameter in the URL path corresponds to the same permission in the scope. That means if you are granted a privileged role, you can only call the privilege class URL.

get.description:
Retrieves the specified managed user by its Entra ID User ID.

This endpoint requires the `User.Privileged.Read`, `User.Privileged.ReadWrite`, `User.Specialized.Read`, `User.Specialized.ReadWrite`, `User.Enterprise.ReadWrite`, `User.Enterprise.Read`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission). The security class parameter in the URL path corresponds to the same permission in the scope. That means if you are granted a privileged role, you can only call the privilege class URL.

Removed user.description: An example of managed user returned that represents the user has been removed from specified security class successfully.

get.summary: Gets Managed User by ID

post.description:
Creates the offering with the requested settings. In the body payload, the `type` property in the `property` object is ignored. See the AVD example.

This endpoint requires the `Intermediary.Privileged.ReadWrite`, `Intermediary.Specialized.ReadWrite`, `Intermediary.Enterprise.ReadWrite`, or the `Everything.ReadWrite` scope (permission). The security class parameter in the URL path corresponds to the same permission in the scope. That means if you are granted a privileged role, you can only call the privilege class URL.

Example intermediary object request.description: An example of create offering request body with minimal fields.

Returned AVD intermediary.description: An example of AVD intermediary object returned that represents an successfully deployed offering.

tags.description: Configures the specified web server to support and process the authentication API routes.
tags.name: Core

tags.description: Used to manage UI and API authentication.
tags.name: Authentication

tags.description: Manages the lifecycle of the various intermediary system types.
tags.name: Intermediary

tags.description: Metadata and deployment management for market offerings. Lifecycle management is not handled in this route.
tags.name: Marketplace

tags.description: Collection of tasks to perform deploy or removal of the infrastructure entities, evaluate details of the resources, handle restoration steps, and support handling architecture/configuration choices from the user.
tags.name: Deploy

tags.description: Manage the updates for SHIELD and the policies deployed into the managed environment.
tags.name: Update
